title: 경험과 현재완료 표현
description: 경험을 나타내는 현재완료 시제와 관련된 단어와 표현을 배웁니다.

words.example: Have you ever been to Paris?

additionalExamples.meaning: 그녀는 한 번도 늦은 적이 없다.

words.example: I have already finished my homework.
I have recently moved to Seoul.

additionalExamples.sentence: He has recently started a new job.

words.example: I have lived here for five years.

additionalExamples.sentence: I have waited for two hours.
We have been friends since Monday.
So far, I have learned 50 words.

words.exampleMeaning: 나는 거기에 한 번 가본 적이 있다.

confusableWords.difference: Once는 한 번, Twice는 두 번

words.mnemonic: Two + ice = 두 번 (숫자 2처럼 tw로 시작)

words.example: I have seen that movie several times.
words.exampleMeaning: 나는 그 영화를 여러 번 봤다.

additionalExamples.sentence: I have been to that restaurant several times.

words.exampleMeaning: 나는 그를 전에 만난 적이 있다.

words.example: This has been a great experience.
I have traveled to many countries.

additionalExamples.sentence: I have tried many new things.

words.example: I have met many interesting people.
I have learned a lot from this class.
words.exampleMeaning: 나는 이 수업에서 많은 것을 배웠다.

words.example: My life has changed a lot.

words.mnemonic: Be → Been: have been to = ~에 가본 적 있다

confusableWords.difference: Been은 갔다 왔다, Gone은 가서 없다
Gone은 가서 없다, Been은 갔다 왔다

words.example: I have given her a gift.

additionalExamples.sentence: Have you given him the message?
Have you spoken to the teacher?
Have you flown in a plane?

words.example: I have known him for years.
I have shown her the way.

additionalExamples.sentence: Have you shown him the photo?

words.example: I have bought a new bag.

additionalExamples.sentence: Have you thought about your answer?

words.mnemonic: Catch → Caught → Caught (catch a cold = 감기 걸리다)

additionalExamples.sentence: Have you felt this way before?

words.example: I have spent all my money.

additionalExamples.sentence: Have you spent time with family?

exercises.question: Which word means '한 번도 ~않다'?
Have you ___ been to Japan?
I have ___ finished my homework. (이미)
Have you finished ___? (아직 - 의문문)
Which preposition is used for a period of time?
Which preposition is used for a starting point?
I have lived here ___ five years. (기간)
I have known her ___ 2020. (시작점)
What does 'once' mean?
What does 'twice' mean?
Match the English with Korean:
I have ___ arrived. (막, 방금)
Which phrase means '지금까지'?
I have visited Japan ___. (두 번)
What does 'recently' mean?
I have ___ to London. (가본 적이 있다)
exercises.explanation: Have been to = ~에 가본 적이 있다 (갔다 왔다)

exercises.question: He has ___ to school. (가버려서 지금 없다)
exercises.explanation: Have gone to = 가버려서 지금 여기 없다

exercises.question: I have ___ my homework. (do의 과거분사)
Have you ___ this movie? (see의 과거분사)
What is the past participle of 'eat'?
I have ___ many photos. (take의 과거분사)
I have ___ her a gift. (give의 과거분사)
What is the past participle of 'write'?
exercises.explanation: Write → Wrote → Written (w는 발음 안 함)

exercises.question: I have ___ to her. (speak의 과거분사)
The window has ___. (break의 과거분사)
I have ___ this one. (choose의 과거분사)
I have ___ his name. (forget의 과거분사)
What is the past participle of 'drive'?
I have ___ to Japan. (fly의 과거분사)
The tree has ___ tall. (grow의 과거분사)
I have ___ him for years. (know의 과거분사)
I have ___ her the way. (show의 과거분사)
What is the past participle of 'buy'?
I have ___ my book. (bring의 과거분사)
I have ___ about it. (think의 과거분사)
I have ___ a cold. (감기에 걸렸다)
exercises.explanation: Catch → Caught → Caught (catch a cold = 감기 걸리다)

exercises.question: I have ___ English. (teach의 과거분사)
What is the past participle of 'feel'?
I have ___ my promise. (keep의 과거분사)
I have ___ well. (sleep의 과거분사)
What is the past participle of 'send'?
I have ___ all my money. (spend의 과거분사)
I have ___ my wallet. (lose의 과거분사)
I have ___ my phone. (find의 과거분사)
I have ___ a cake. (make의 과거분사)
Match the verb with its past participle:
Match the verb with its past participle:
Match the verb with its past participle:
Which is correct? 'I have ___ there.'
exercises.explanation: 현재완료에서는 have + 과거분사를 사용합니다. Be → Been

exercises.question: Which sentence is correct?
She has ___ that book many times. (read의 과거분사)
I have ___ to that song before. (listen은 규칙동사)
Have you ___ your room? (clean은 규칙동사)
They have ___ here for many years. (live의 과거분사)
'Have you ever been to Paris?' 의 의미는?
exercises.explanation: Have been to = ~에 가본 적이 있다 (경험)

exercises.question: I have ___ this before. (hear의 과거분사)
She has ___ a lot of weight. (lose의 과거분사)
I have ___ him the truth. (tell의 과거분사)
We have ___ a new car. (get의 과거분사)
exercises.explanation: Get → Got → Got/Gotten (영국식: got, 미국식: gotten)

exercises.question: Have you ___ about the news? (hear의 과거분사)
I have ___ 5km today. (run의 과거분사)
She has ___ here since 2019. (work은 규칙동사)
Match the verb with its past participle:
'I haven't finished yet' 의 의미는?
I have ___ to move to a new city. (decide는 규칙동사)
She has ___ all her homework. (finish는 규칙동사)
Have you ever ___ skiing? (try의 과거분사)
I have ___ this song many times. (sing의 과거분사)
She has ___ in the ocean. (swim의 과거분사)
We have ___ the bell. (ring의 과거분사)
I have ___ coffee this morning. (have의 과거분사)
Match the time expression with its meaning:
I have ___ many mistakes. (make의 과거분사)
He has ___ a lot recently. (grow의 과거분사)
'I have just eaten' 의 의미는?
She has ___ me before. (see의 과거분사)
I have ___ the door. (shut의 과거분사)
We have ___ this game before. (play는 규칙동사)
Match the verb with its past participle:
I have ___ the whole book. (read의 과거분사)
exercises.explanation: Read → Read → Read (철자는 같지만 발음이 다름)

exercises.question: She has ___ a new car. (buy의 과거분사)
'He has gone home' 의 의미는?
exercises.explanation: Have gone to = 가버려서 지금 여기 없다

exercises.question: I have ___ all night. (study는 규칙동사)
Have you ___ of this artist?
They have ___ the party. (leave의 과거분사)
I have ___ a letter to my friend. (write의 과거분사)
Match the verb with its past participle:
He has ___ his bag at home. (forget의 과거분사)
For vs Since: I have lived here ___ 10 years.
For vs Since: I have lived here ___ 2015.
She has ___ him the news. (tell의 과거분사)
I have ___ my keys somewhere. (put의 과거분사)
We have ___ the game. (win의 과거분사)
They have ___ married for 5 years.
exercises.explanation: Have been married = 결혼한 상태로 있다

exercises.question: Match the verb with its past participle:
exercises.explanation: i → a → u 변화 패턴의 동사들입니다.

exercises.question: I have ___ the bill. (pay의 과거분사)
She has ___ us a lot. (help는 규칙동사)
They have ___ the movie. (begin의 과거분사)
I have ___ enough water today. (drink의 과거분사)
We have ___ the truth. (understand의 과거분사)
I have ___ this movie three times. (watch는 규칙동사)
She has ___ her leg. (break의 과거분사)
'She has already left' 의 의미는?
I have never ___ to that restaurant. (go의 과거분사)
exercises.explanation: Have never been to = ~에 가본 적이 없다

exercises.question: They have ___ a decision. (make의 과거분사)
exercises.explanation: Make a decision = 결정을 내리다. Make → Made → Made

exercises.question: Have you ever ___ a car? (drive의 과거분사)
Match the sentence with its meaning:
How long have you ___ here? (live의 과거분사)
exercises.explanation: How long have you lived = 얼마나 오래 살았나요?

exercises.question: I have ___ the newspaper. (read의 과거분사)
exercises.explanation: Read → Read → Read (철자 동일, 발음 다름)

exercises.question: She has ___ a new language. (learn의 과거분사)
We have ___ together for years. (work는 규칙동사)
Have you ___ dinner?
She has ___ a lot of money. (save는 규칙동사)
'I have lived here for 3 years' - for의 역할은?
Match the verb with its past participle:
I have ___ my keys again. (lose의 과거분사)
They have ___ married since 2018.
exercises.explanation: Have been married since = ~부터 결혼한 상태

exercises.question: She has ___ me the answer. (give의 과거분사)
I have ___ to this city before. (come의 과거분사)
Have you ___ the new movie? (see의 과거분사)
Which is the past participle of 'become'?
We have ___ a lot of pizza. (order는 규칙동사)
Match For or Since:
She has ___ a book about history. (write의 과거분사)
I have ___ to call him many times. (try의 과거분사)
'Have you heard?' 의 의미는?
He has ___ in many countries. (live의 과거분사)
They have ___ the project. (finish는 규칙동사)
I have ___ a new job. (find의 과거분사)
Match the expression with correct usage:
I have ___ the door. (open은 규칙동사)
She has ___ her phone. (drop은 규칙동사, pp 추가)
We have ___ the test. (pass는 규칙동사)
I have ___ the problem. (solve는 규칙동사)
'She has become famous' - become의 과거분사는?
Have you ___ the email? (receive는 규칙동사)
Match the verb with its past participle:
I have ___ to Europe twice. (fly의 과거분사)
She has ___ her room. (clean은 규칙동사)
'I have known him for years' 의 의미는?
options: 나는 그를 몇 년 후에 알게 될 것이다
나는 그를 몇 년 전에 알았다
exercises.explanation: Have known + for years = 수년간 알고 지내다 (계속)

exercises.question: They have ___ the building. (build의 과거분사)
I have ___ lunch. (eat의 과거분사)
She has ___ me a message. (send의 과거분사)
Match the verb with its past participle:
We have ___ a new house. (buy의 과거분사)
I have ___ the movie twice. (watch는 규칙동사)
'Have you ever met a celebrity?' 의 의미는?
exercises.explanation: Have you ever met = ~을 만난 적 있나요? (경험)

exercises.question: He has ___ me a favor. (do의 과거분사)
exercises.explanation: Do a favor = 부탁을 들어주다. Do → Did → Done

exercises.question: I have ___ this book before. (read의 과거분사)
Match the present perfect sentence with its use:
options: I have lived here for 5 years.
exercises.explanation: 현재완료의 다양한 용법 (경험, 계속, 완료, 부정 경험)을 연결합니다.
